events.title: Morning Assault Ignites as 30 Corps Comes Under Attack on July 30th
events.description: The attack started on 30 Corps front at 0600 hours 30th July.

events.title: Second Army Launches Strategic Southern Offensive from Caumont on July 30th
events.description: Second Army regrouped with creditable speed, and it was found possible to commence the thrust southwards from the Caumont area on 30th July.

events.title: Massive Air Assault: Over 1,200 Bombers Deliver 2,227 Tons of Destruction to Support Second British Army
events.description: 279. The fourth attack was in support of the Second British Army south of Caumont. The preliminary heavy air bombardment was launched early on 30th July and 693 heavy bombers of R.A.F. Bomber Command and over 500 light and medium bombers of A.E.A.F, dropped 2,227 tons of bombs.

events.title: Admiral Fisher Consults Russian Authorities as Air Ministry Secures Key Agreement
events.description: 15 Agreement was reached with the Air Ministry by 30th July, and Admiral Fisher (in Moscow) was asked for his views after consultation with the Russian authorities.

events.title: Naval Maneuver: ADVENTURE Detached as Force Passes Through on July 30
events.description: The Force passed through: Position   Cc   about 0300 on the 30th July and ADVENTURE was detached. As she was only -one hour behind her programine I did not consider it necessary to make an amended  time   for her rendezvous. | _ - :

events.title: Victory Celebrated: AM Achieves Triumph on July 30, 1941!
FURIOUS Aircraft Strike Petsamo: Operation E.F. Report Revealed
events.description: Attack by FURIOUS  Aircraft on Petsamo on Wednesday, 30th July, 1941. I have the honour to forward herewith a report of Operation   E.F.
